action.action-desc: Mr. McCormick (for himself and Mr. Ezell) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To direct courts to award attorneys fees in criminal cases that do not result in a conviction, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Litigation Reimbursement Act.

section.header: Award of attorneys fees required in criminal cases that do not result in a conviction
section.text: Section 617 of the Departments of Commerce, Justice, and State, the Judiciary, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1998 (18 U.S.C. 3006A note) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking fiscal year 1998 and inserting fiscal year 2026;
by striking pending on or after the date of the enactment of this Act and inserting pending on or after the date of the enactment of the Litigation Reimbursement Act; and

by striking may award to a prevailing party, other than the United States, a reasonable attorney's fee and other litigation expenses, where the court finds that the position of the United States was vexatious, frivolous, or in bad faith, and inserting shall award to a prevailing party, other than the United States, a reasonable attorney’s fee and other litigation expenses, in any case that proceeds to trial and with respect to which a verdict is rendered by the judge or jury that is not a conviction,.

section.header: Award of costs and fees required in civil cases
section.text: Section 2412 of title 28, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking may be awarded and inserting shall be awarded; and
in subsection (b), by striking may be awarded and inserting shall be awarded.
